definition: to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means
to praise without cease (idiom); praise sb to high heaven
to praise without cease (idiom); praise sb to high heaven
(of sound) to never stop/to fall incessantly on the ear/to linger on
unceasing torrent (idiom)/talking non-stop/gabbling forty to the dozen
hanging by a thread/very precarious/almost extinct/(of sound) linger on faintly
to scold without end (idiom); incessant abuse
to come and go in an incessant stream

sentences.english: The reason Burundi is so poor is because they have never really had any peaceful time between the everlasting civil wars.
sentences.chinese: 這個國家貧窮的真正原因是因爲連綿不絕的內戰。

sentences.english: This is while he was been ill these days.
sentences.chinese: 這是由於他這些天不絕在害病。

sentences.english: The mountain ridges in this area twist and twine, stretching endlessly.
sentences.chinese: 這個山區的山脈蜿蜒曲折，連綿不絕。

sentences.english: He completely monopolized the conversation last night; Mary and I couldn't get a word in edgeways.
sentences.chinese: 他昨晚滔滔不絕地講話，瑪麗和我完全插不上嘴。

sentences.english: People gushing on and on about their amazing love life?
sentences.chinese: 有人滔滔不絕地講述她們那讓人驚歎的愛情生活？

sentences.english: In all that sprawling city, there was everything except an end. There was no end.
sentences.chinese: 連綿不絕的城市，什麼都有，除了盡頭，沒有盡。

sentences.english: A continuous stream of visitors came to the exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 參觀展覽會的人絡繹不絕。

sentences.english: The whale only gets harpooned when he spouts.
sentences.chinese: 只有得到的鯨魚時，他滔滔不絕地鏢。

sentences.english: The night sky with colorful Band gorgeous, the crowd flocked to the carnival.
sentences.chinese: 夜晚，同樂坊的天空五彩斑斕，狂歡的人羣絡繹不絕。

sentences.english: Sunlit waterfall spray tumbles into our boat and a chorus of various insects rings in our ears.
sentences.chinese: 陽光下的瀑布水花灑落進小船，蟲鳴聲不絕於耳。

sentences.english: After his speech, applause went on endlessly.
sentences.chinese: 講話結束後，掌聲絡繹不絕。

sentences.english: Every words poured out it echoes of your love.
sentences.chinese: 每次滔滔不絕的字都有你愛的迴音。

sentences.english: She talks so much that the rest of us never get a look-in .
sentences.chinese: 他講得滔滔不絕，別人都無法插嘴。

sentences.english: While the master quietly served tea, the professor talked about Zen.
sentences.chinese: 當禪師安靜地準備茶水時，學者滔滔不絕地談着禪。

sentences.english: Charles is such a gasser when he gets going about himself.
sentences.chinese: 查爾斯一談到自己，就勁頭十足，滔滔不絕。

sentences.english: Kuguan member Liu Xinghua transformation of the powder keg full of praise.
sentences.chinese: 庫管員劉興華對火藥庫改造讚不絕口。

definition: to accompany/to follow/to occur together with/concomitant
to pass on/to spread/to transmit/to infect/to transfer/to circulate/to conduct (electricity)
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)
one after another/in succession/one by one/continuously/diverse/in profusion/numerous and confused/pell-mell
